meanings.definition: A daily record of news and events
meanings.sent1: Every morning, Sarah writes in her journal about what happened the day before.
meanings.sent2: The journalist reported on the latest events in the city in his journal.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the journal, spilling yesterday's news all over the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her journal was a treasure trove of memories, like a time capsule waiting to be opened.
meanings.sent5: The journal was filled with vivid descriptions of the bustling city life.

meanings.definition: A periodical publication containing articles and research
meanings.sent1: The library had a collection of journals on various scientific topics.
meanings.sent2: She subscribed to a medical journal to keep up with the latest research findings.
meanings.sent3: The journal on marine life had an article about talking dolphins, which made her chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a journal of knowledge, each page filled with new discoveries.
meanings.sent5: The journal was a window into the world of academia, offering insights into groundbreaking studies.

meanings.definition: A book or digital platform for recording personal thoughts and experiences
meanings.sent1: Emily poured her heart out in her journal, expressing her deepest emotions.
meanings.sent2: He kept a digital journal to document his travels around the world.
meanings.sent3: The journal on his nightstand held the secrets of his innermost thoughts.
meanings.sent4: Her journal was a mirror reflecting her growth and self-discovery.
meanings.sent5: The journal was a sanctuary where she could be truly herself, unfiltered and raw.
